Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw two different habitats, one land-based and one water-based.
The student can illustrate different kinds of plants and animals in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, or fish.
The student can show comparisons by including different types of living things in each habitat and highlighting the differences.
The student can use patterns to demonstrate plant and animal diversity across the two habitats.
The student can organize the drawing to clearly make observations about the environment and living things, supporting the understanding of habitat diversity.
